line_1: Now I should be extremely loath,
line_2: Not to be thought expert in Both.

line_1: He takes what he at first profess'd to loath,
line_2: And in due time feeds heartily on both;

line_1: Blind to their good, to be instructed loth,
line_2: Men are but children of a larger growth;

line_1: But quit the blest abode, tho' loth,
line_2: And quickly passing, ease us both.

line_1: M— (on such occasion I am loath
line_2: To name the dead) was a rare proof of both.

line_1: Fond to begin but still to finish loth,
line_2: Come, lig no more upon the Bed of Sloth,

line_1: Fond to begin but still to finish loth,
line_2: Thy half-writ Scrolls all eaten by the Moth:

line_1: Fond to begin but still to finish loth,
line_2: Who with the Sons of Softness nobly wroth,

line_1: While tasteless you can greet her smiles so loth;
line_2: And quit your pillow with reluctant sloth,

line_1: Yet I confess I'm always loth
line_2: To think such beauty was but froth,

line_1: Who to be silent always loth,
line_2: Would speak on either side or both,

line_1: The gaping banks receded, as though loth
And women, Will, are very loath
line_2: Men should feel joys not felt by both.
